section.title: Overview
section.p: Log4js is a logging API for JavaScript. The main goal is to have a robust and solid logging API which is very simmilar to the Java logging API Log4j.

section.title: Severals ways to log

ul.li: WindowAppender : open a new window in the browser and insert log messages in real time.
WindowsEventAppender : send log messages in the MS Windows event manager[2].
FileAppender : write log messages in a local file on the client[3].
AjaxAppender : allow to send log messages to a remote server with asynchronous HTTP request.
MetatagAppender : add log messages as meta data[4].

section.p: Many Appender can be used in a same time.

section.title: Usage
section.p: Log4js is a simple API, which could be included in your scripts:
section.source:
<script src="log4js.js" type="text/javascript"></script> 
                <script type="text/javascript">
                <!-- // //initialize the logger with your category 
                var log = new Log4js.Logger("ajaxTest"); 
                //set the level of logging 
                log.setLevel(Log4js.Level.ALL); 
                //set the Appender to write the log to 
                log.addAppender(new AjaxAppender(log, "./log4j.jsp")); 
                // -->
                </script>
section.p: Now you can call the log in your logic like follow line:
section.source: <input type="button" name="trace" value="Trace" onclick="log.trace('I was traced!');return false;" />

section.title: Conclusion
section.p: There are other libraries in order to get this goal. We are discussing with the authors of another logging APIs in order to gather thier efforts and provide a common framework if possible.
Log4js is very simple to install and use.
